TopicTitle: Lately, I have been wandering into the dangerous land of 300+ part counts

Articles.Content:
370 parts

And I think I like it. Credit to Temstar for the awesome Zenith IV launcher.

(Maybe I'll share this craft in the Spacecraft Exchange. After I get some screens of it in action)

Only 370 parts? My PC eats that for breakfast. The craft looks really cool though. I really love the torrodial tanks sticking down. They look really sharp. I almost thought they were rover wheels actually.

3,900 parts. 168 rocket motors, in 8 clusters of 21 motors each. Launches at 1 frame per second. From liftoff to fuel out takes one hour twenty minutes.

Prior to liftoff.

Edited July 1, 2013 by Whackjob
If it takes 80 minutes at 1 fps, that would be about 3 minutes in 25 or more fps.

Looks like you removed a lot of struts from that design since I've last checked your thread, Whackjob. Good work on optimizing it.

I swear you must really hate your CPU the way you play KSP, it's hilarious.
Any reasons for you to have Subassembly Loader and Subassembly Manager at the same time?

Any reasons for you to have Subassembly Loader and Subassembly Manager at the same time?

Strangely, I had Subassembly Loader in the old Plugins folder, and the new one in the GameData folder. Fixed it!

Also, Whackjob, that is insane. Insane insanity. Repetitive redundancy?
Wackjob has really gotten into the game.
firerider521, can you post .craft file? Your ship looks awesome, I would try it.
I'll post it in the Spacecraft Exchange once I confirm that it DOES, in fact, have enough fuel to actually get to the Mun and back. Apollo-style missions are a little harder than I anticipated.
Yeah, NASA had some issues with them as well. :]
all I can say is WHY!!! and ADD MORE SRBS!!!!

You wanted it, you got it!

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/38918-Positivity-III-2-Man-Mun-lander-Apollo-Style-PICTURE-DENSE?p=497486#post497486

Craft file, pics, an' everything!

This looks totally insane. XD And i was proud on my 1000+ Designs and they had already difficulties to start cause of fps drops. I do not think that i would be able to start that one.

@Firerider521:

Its a very good start and a very nice and classy design.

You will see that the huge part ships open whole new possibilities of designs but also can be very frustrating.
